\usepackage{hyperref}

\title{Spiral Wavefields from $J$-Cost with $\varphi$-Scaling and Eight-Gate Neutrality}
\author{Recognition Physics Institute}
\date{\today}

\begin{document}
\maketitle

\begin{abstract}
We propose a fit-free spiral-field variational ansatz: under the unique convex
cost $J$ and $\varphi$-scaling, with an eight-phase neutrality gate, the
stationary in-plane flow takes a logarithmic-spiral form
$r(\theta) = r_0\,\varphi^{\kappa\,\theta/(2\pi)}$ with integral pitch
parameter $\kappa$. We outline falsifiers via pitch histograms clustered on
$\tan\psi\in\{\varphi^{-n}\}$.
\end{abstract}

\section{Ansatz and constraints}
Eight-gate neutrality is enforced by aligned $8$-step sums; $\varphi$-scaling
fixes the spiral exponent. We conjecture the pitch $\kappa$ is pinned by the
same curvature packet ($\pm4$ over $8$ faces) used in the $G$ derivation.

\paragraph{Sampled cost (discrete evaluation).}
With a step size $\Delta\theta$ and $N$ samples, define the step ratio
$x_n=\tfrac{r(\theta_n+\Delta\theta)}{r(\theta_n)}$ where
$\theta_n=\theta_0+n\,\Delta\theta$, and evaluate
$\sum_{n=0}^{N-1} J(x_n)$ with $J(x)=\tfrac12(x+1/x)-1$. Neutrality is probed
by aligned sums over windows of $8$ steps.

\section{Falsifiers}
Reject if pitch distributions in spiral morphologies do not cluster on
predicted $\varphi$ bands or if neutrality cannot be realized in aligned
windows.

\end{document}
